text: How to generate permutations of a list without "reverse duplicates" in Python using generators
This is related to question How to generate all permutations of a list in Python

childList.text: How to generate all permutations of a list in Python

text: How to generate all permutations that match following criteria: if two permutations are reverse of each other (i.e.
[1,2,3,4] and [4,3,2,1]), they are considered equal and only one of them should be in final result.

childList.text: if two permutations are reverse of each other (i.e. [1,2,3,4] and [4,3,2,1]), they are considered equal and only one of them should be in final result

text: I am permuting lists that contain unique integers.
The number of resulting permutations will be high so I'd like to use Python's generators if possible.
Edit:  I'd like not to store list of all permutations to memory if possible.
